Award.AwardTitle: Improving The Mathamatics Education At Wiley College

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
Wiley College, a 137 year old, four-year, liberal arts, accredited, private historically black college located in Marshall, TX, has a Targeted Infusion Project that is aiming to transform its mathematics curriculum and increase student achievement in mathematics. The College has grown, increasing its enrollment by approximately 50% since 2002. Its science, technology, engineering and mathematics programs have grown proportionately, but recent analysis points to a disturbing trend: the College's STEM students are not performing at an adequate level in mathematics courses, especially in required first-year courses.

Wiley College will recruit new mathematics faculty with training and experience in developmental and first-year mathematics education and a successful track record of successfully integrating fundamental mathematical concepts into other STEM disciplines. The goals of the project are to: a) transform the developmental and first-year mathematics courses to allow greater student performance in mathematics; b) infuse mathematics topics in the non-mathematics STEM courses, allowing for greater integration of mathematics across all STEM disciplines; c) implement up-to-date pedagogical methods and best practices to attract and engage students in core mathematics courses that provide the foundation for the other sciences; and d) implement improvement in the training of future teachers of mathematics by enhancing the science/mathematics teacher preparation program.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Wiley College, through its successfully-funded National Science Foundation (NSF) grant, "Improving the Mathematics Education at Wiley College," was able to re-engineer the way that it teaches mathematics for its science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) students through the completion of the following activities:

A.) Curriculm Re-Alignment for the Department of Mathematics - The principal parties of this grant re-aligned the specific competencies in those mathematics courses that all STEM majors must take (such as Precalculus I and II and Probability and Statistics) such that those comptencies are reinforced in non-math STEM courses such as General Chemistry and General Biology.

B.) Curriculum Re-Alignment for Teacher Education Students - A similar curriculum realignment was performed for those math classes taken by the College's Teacher Education students.  This re-alignment focused on those competencies that are required and assessed through certification examinations for elementary and secondary mathematics education students.

C.)  Creaton of a Mathematics Lab - As the foundation for the creation of a Center for Mathematics Excellence at Wiley College, a Mathematics Lab was created in a dedicated space in the Aaron Baker Science Building.  This lab consists of networked computers loaded with open-source and commercial software that assists mathematics majors in preparing for and excelling in their coursework, as well a provides a space through which the College's Pre-College Mathematics Program can prepare entering freshman for their general education mathematics courses.

These activities have resulted in increased enrollment and retention in both mathematics and non-mathematics STEM majors at Wiley College, and grant-related activities will be sustained as a result of grant-related accomplishments.
